Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.santorini.view.cli

Class CLIReader

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.santorini.view.cli.CLIReader
public class CLIReader
extends java.lang.Object
Brief Reader class for the CLI that saves the input in the memory once read

    • getCorrectInput

      java.lang.Integer getCorrectInput​(java.lang.String messageToDisplay, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> correctInputs)
      Brief Asks the user to type something, then checks if the input is correct (in format and value)
      Parameters:
      messageToDisplay - is the message to send to the player
      correctInputs - are all the possible correct inputs
      Returns:
      the correct input

    • parseInput

      private java.lang.Integer parseInput​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> correctInputs)
      Brief Parses the input to check if it has a proper value, otherwise discards it
      Parameters:
      correctInputs - is the list of Inputs to parse
      Returns:
      the input's value or null if it is badly formatted or if its value doesn't belongs to the correct inputs

    • isUtilityInput

      private java.lang.Boolean isUtilityInput() throws InterruptionException
      Brief Checks if the input entered by the user concerns secondary "helping" commands like showing cards or rules or if it's a quit request
      Returns:
      true if the input is one of the helping commands
      Throws:
      InterruptionException - if the reading process has been interrupted for some reason

    • readLine

      protected java.lang.String readLine()
      Brief Reads a complete line from the input discarding it if it's empty
      Returns:
      the read line or null if the input is empty

      protected java.lang.Boolean getUndoChoice()
      Brief Gets the player's choice for the undo functionality
      Returns:
      true if the player decided to undo the turn, false otherwise
